content:
After approving I see 1 thing I didn't see earlier. There is not enough validators for a game with a luck factor of this degree. Can you add 3 of each Length extra?

- It's wierd we can't see the validators names atleast, before approval :/

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Feels like a funny addition to the site, even though it might be a little random. There is enough test-cases to not win too easily on luck.

How do you score unfinished testcases?
When I send all numbers equal:
Sent a number with not unique digits
bulls: 0, cows: 0
Total actions count: 1

But when I can't solve it in given time: 
You did not make it in 300 turns!
bulls: 1, cows: 9
Total actions count: 300

And what about actually solving it in exactly 300 actions?

Total game duration too long.

- Got this when I did not manage to solve it

- Game misses time constraints
- Contrast of numbers are too bad. Make background fully dark and letters whitesmoke
- Same with contrast of Cows

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Cool Idea!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Accepted this puzzle. I like author's approach to solution validation: in each testcase hidden number isn't fixed, but it's generated randomly on every validation with fixed `bulls` and `cows`. It prevents hardcoding and provides robustness to random solutions.

Nice one! 
Please correct the following things:
"adoptation" => "adaptation"
"where you will need to guess ..." => "where you have to guess ..."
"you will now how many ..." => "you will know how many ..."

Error> Test Case 14 labeled 'Length = 4' is indeed of length 1.

Change the test or re-label
Nice contribution, but I feel like the luck-factor kills the fun-factor (not your fault, of course, it's Bulls and Cows..)

Very interesting puzzle.

I don't understand why I have the error "wrong number format" with number like 2165093784 or 2150947386 when I try length=10.

UPD: fixed
sorry, my bad, the issue was the max int value in java, will fix it in a min

UPD: fixed
thx, will check that today.
Luck-factor shouldn't be much problem, because in validators the secret is generated after the first guess with fixed number of cows and bulls, some people advised for more tests to reduce randomness, still don't now if that is necessary, but probably will do so

UPD: fixed
Thanks! I'll correct these mistakes in the evening

Thx, i'll add an information on time constrains and will correct the colors, although as for cows, they give an additional information, when the count of digits is less than 10. i.e. the summ of bulls and cows is the count of digits that is both in a secret and in a guess, while bulls itself is only the digits that takes the correct spots
this indicates that you overcome the 250 turns limit

Thx for great testing. I did not actually thought about some aspects you noticed. 

I assumed that if you failed the test the score does not matter, so I count only the guesses that were actually made, although it is probably a good idea to cap actions count at for example 300 when the test is failed, do you think it should be done this way or there is another?

As for exactly 300 actions there definetly was a bug, players code would still be executed after loosing the game, now the game would be winnable at turn 300.

Dbdr also suggested that, so i'll do so, thx for your interest and a lot of suggestions. It is not a problem if the count of tests and validators would be different? CG suggested in docs that tests should match validators, so this is the only reason i didn't add more.

There are 20 testcases in the IDE and only 10 validators on submit..
And no, they can be very unequal :)

Thx, I cutted out validators from tests, intended to do that and has forgotten, and added 36 more validators, without length=1 because it is pure random and I assign 5 actions for it any way. Should be enough.
Sounds good. Add a message when it's updated. And I'll check again.

I see the old scores are still there. Think CG doesn't clean up properly :(
I asked on Discord.
Should be available now, also varied count of bulls and cows across the tests a little.
Or do you mean that wrong action still counts as an action?

I think you can give the player score anyhow as long as you sort it Ascending.

So if the player does an invalid action or never guesses correctly: 400 score. (or worse, just not too bad. As players solving it at the last frame gets 300 score) 
So that players get 100% even though they can't solve all levels.. I guess a length of 10 without a good algorithm might be hard for some approaches, and I think the puzzle makes more fun if you get 100% and scores along the way :) 

Just my opinion.. As I like users to feel some progression without being in a hopeless state.

Might also be an idea to reverse the scores.
Base score is 400 and 1 is subtracted every round. 
Making a solution at round 1 give 400 points.. Round 35 365 points.. etc.

Wow, i didn't think of that, although im not sure if that is convinient enough for players? I mean it would look like you passed the validators even though you didn't. Wouldn't that be too easy from pazzle point of view? Although i do like how NS was designed, and basically nobody abused it, so probably it should just have convinient description on scoring?

Yeah, might be true. Just let users fail if they can't beat a level.

Yeah, explaining the scoring should be good enough

So i will change the scoring tommorow, probably will just make losing result in 400 actions and failing the test for convinience. Do not know about the reversing though, seems a little bit overcomplicated.

I think reversing isn't a good idea as well as penalty for failed tests. Penalty is unnecessary because codingamers in the leaderboard are sorted by completness percentage (greater is better) then by puzzle-specific score (number of guesses in this case).  So why do we need additional penalty for failed tests?
Well basically that was my logic

Although the argument here is that passing the validators would result in more actions than failing them, and i do see some inconsistence here, so i made losing add to total score a 301 actions, i think it's generally more convinient and obvious

No, you give the player too much time. Game crashes around 200 rounds and I can't read the error prints.
Make it 50 ms and 300 rounds.
Ok, thx, will do that then.
Fixed, thx again, didn't actually notice that after increasing turn duration.
Yeah, true. Only tried the 10 number one and forgot :D
Added information on max turn time and fixed constrast a little, although i decided to keep background, plane black was not that good

- You did not make it in 250 turns!


You forgot to change it to 300, but game works now. I will try to solve it later today and approve.
Oh, sorry, the error message was hardcoded, although the duration is actually changed to 300. Error message is now also fixed.
